title: AKA boasts about conning fans with fake split, says he masterminded the whole thing
text:
Yes Papa Penny, but what exactly are 'spiritual diamonds'? 
Although the musician's lie was suspected from the moment he took to Twitter on Friday to announce that he and Bonang had 'split,' his detailed explanation on how he plotted with Bonang to fool fans and the media again saw the couple targeted on social media. 
In an interview with The Plug Mag AKA said that while he wanted to release his new song, Caiphus Song , sooner rather than later, Sony and VTH Season wanted to hold back. Eventually they relented and AKA had to think of a concept. 
"I then had to come up with a strategy to keep people talking throughout the weekend up until Tuesday. I worked backwards from there. We planned all the tweets from Friday up until the gift on Monday, and eventually the release." Nipples and thigh: 4 sizzling pictures from Khanyi Mbau's Previdar shoot 
Plug Mag, the small music mag that got the only interview with AKA on the issue, called it a "genius marketing strategy." AKA said that Bonang knew about it and called her a "visionary" for taking part in the mass lie.

As reported by TshisaLIVE at the time of the 'split,' there was doubt from the very start. Why? Well, because they've split so many times before (and even deleted all of their pictures on social media) that another breakup, if true, was a yawn fest this time around more than anything else.
